A16294576AF84D3C80CAF9A49601CD02.description: Expand vocabulary and language usage (e.g., use words to describe the purpose and function of objects, learn the names of new objects).

037DD22F7725448E9F206E258F2D2154.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

957CB522A88E49CE86C947BA8FF89386.description: Expand vocabulary and language usage (e.g., use words to describe the purpose and function of objects, learn the names of new objects).

5600D884EE9E4FCB8F96C15178BF9CE6.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

E68D2B984FA04746852C4C44E754B567.description:
Begin to develop
writing skills by
recognizing that
drawings, paintings
and writing are
meaningful
representations (e.g. begin to
control scribbles,
perhaps telling caregiver what they say).

00EE633C5C1D4A6C89154A150C99FDCA.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

41A8C6C97CE84F0EA701B420D03EB618.description: Use more conventions of speech when speaking (e.g., use ‘s’ at the end of plurals and ‘ed’ for past tense, use plurals, pronouns and possessive words such as “my” and “his").

20214D45CC6B42CF858BFE463AADF405.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

F10DC5C4214A4450A33ED05758B657C3.description:
Use more
conventions of
speech when
speaking (e.g., not
pronounce all of
his words correctly,
but be easily understood most of the time.

3663BF059B97462FBAFE70FFFF9D0B3E.description:
Adapt  speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when
indicated or appropriate.

1D04DBACC19144DFA433C3AD804D0957.description: Use  writing utensils for scribble and drawings (e.g., begin to draw representations of people and objects).

8F31DE5FB8424287AE6541C09043026A.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

4268EC32049D4FC8A66FD7A0F3464C0C.description:
Demonstrate active
listening skills (e.g.,
retell, and relate to
what has been
heard).

003044CD1F2B44D2A293A5D5ECD4B5D1.description:
Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the
organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

27D46C86D9FC49E2A4FEBCEB20E047CF.description: Show understanding and respond to simple directions and requests (e.g., begin to ask “how” and “why” questions).

DA380993BF9A47D8B2E8FB0230AD29E7.description: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

F7E5EFCC0B194A569B66E45758FF1ED2.description:
Demonstrate active
listening skills (e.g.,
ask questions about
what has been
heard).

E37CD2B22C6C448B898A02A3A984BFB6.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

BA1297D84EB442A892AEF1D384467B7E.description:
Have more meaningful
conversations with
peers and adults
(e.g., offer own
information in a
group story or
discussion about a
visit by the
firefighters, talk to
a friend or
caregiver, an
imaginary friend, or
the dolls and toys
that he is playing
with).

0D431FE803554D52BEED61FB69E7311C.description:
Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on
others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

3CC726C4832D40258854189994F2A014.description: Begin to develop writing skills by recognizing that drawings, paintings and writing are meaningful representations (e.g., show a friend his picture on a wall).

25EC853E5DCD423D831305E8802F719D.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

1BEFC8A025A84E13860DD52B095CDE90.description: Begin to develop writing skills by recognizing that drawings, paintings and writing are meaningful representations (e.g., make a picture of self with lines coming out of the bottom and sides of a circle).

84B26FF414CE49928AEED29FEB328506.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

E4C4F2EC2DDD47BCBE58565FF1AAC396.description:
Begin to develop
writing skills by
recognizing that
drawings, paintings
and writing are
meaningful
representations
(e.g., pretend to
take your order
while playing
restaurant by
scribbling on a pad with a pencil).

4D6FE812DE334E5A81B7333DC27B96DC.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately
through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

478267E36A6343228848E629F2F33F48.description: Begin to develop writing skills by recognizing that drawings, paintings and writing are meaningful representations (e.g., begin to control scribbles, perhaps telling caregiver what they say).

2F0912A3D6EC483C8A762CB6F4E5EE1F.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

4C401B13C17A45DB93F39FA208A3AF1A.description:
Begin to develop
fluency by imitative
reading (e.g., listen
to models of fluent
reading, ask to
reread a favorite
story, remembering
the funny ending
and telling it as you
start to read).

5DCE927F87874A989FD62A671D5C7E45.description:
Engage with a variety of texts with purpose and understanding. Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support
 comprehension.

71F0E69A5CB64A989898D5193895392B.description:
Recognize that
symbols have
corresponding
meaning (e.g., look
for and identify
familiar logos or
signs, find own
name card on a
carpet square and
sit there).

7C6B60E4E58F4A919EFA3AD52A4B2488.description: Know and apply grade- level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

D567999471844793B74944320AB87D5F.description:
Develop
phonological
awareness by
becoming aware
of the sounds of
spoken language
(e.g., begin to
supply rhyming
words in a familiar
poem or song,
draw attention to
parts of words
such as syllables
by moving or
clapping).

24610919B7BB4198A0A1680374A60762.description: RF2 Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

A865432D901B4DDA84A4D1219F1FCCF3.description: Recognize that symbols have corresponding meaning (e.g., sing the alphabet song, pointing to the letters).

7D2D081507C64EBD86FDF3E1D0B68C81.description: RF1 Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

834A62FF29D040AD90137B1CEAA46D8C.description:
Develop
comprehension by
demonstrating
understanding of
text during and
after reading (e.g.,
makes guesses
about what a book
is about).

6EB4A23B9D9548ADB9AD6311910A04F1.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

DE72E8084CF846E98ED67CCB723A8C32.description:
Develop
comprehension by
demonstrating
understanding of
text during and
after reading (e.g.,
ask and answer
questions about a
book).

9306DC66FC604562830D9DB60777C4CF.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the
relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

78F3A7F5D3E247989BD99C068141641B.description: Develop comprehension by demonstrating understanding of text during and after reading (e.g., point out familiar concepts by looking at pictures in a text).

3A2A1B973E3543B7969FB03252AA3FC7.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.*

9C9DB46EF825497EB5E793A217F88747.description:
Develop comprehension by
demonstrating
understanding of
text during and
after reading (e.g.,
listen to and
discuss a variety of
books).

06CBF962C07B47D2928990A974E373A8.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

A50CA798492A4C7F9C8A1FEA85F79024.description: Develop comprehension by demonstrating understanding of text during and after reading (e.g., listen to a variety of fiction and non- fiction materials).

41A0078D79D449589ABE7739681705B2.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

C57E96C82CFA40FD97D0B8D82BBD20E2.description:
Expand vocabulary
and language usage
(e.g., discover the
meaning of new
words from the
context or
pictures).

A6878E5457834727ABE0B3A6903E948E.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative
meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

D34E2641B993495DBFE0A44B3216905C.description: Story/Text Comprehension: Develop comprehension by demonstrating understanding of text during and after reading (e.g., make up a story about a book).

E4C027D6112F4C29A367642A6CF27964.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of text.

971E69A6ACE14C718961D607070C1BF3.description:
Develop
comprehension by
demonstrating
understanding of
text during and
after reading (e.g.,
point out familiar
concepts by looking
at pictures in a
text).

E92A0A0DFB034C08903A97370650AEE4.description:
Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and
ideas.

20669EDA151843A0BE0700AC94B30AF8.description: Develop comprehension by demonstrating understanding of text during and after reading (e.g., make guesses about what a book is about).

EFC1F877FAF549078B7FCB335C39B125.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

Develop
